title: Architecture Overview Presentation
prompt: Create a 15-slide interactive presentation showcasing a modern AI-powered web platform architecture. Include slides for: system metrics (number of apps, components, skills), architecture layer stack (apps ‚Üí components ‚Üí design system ‚Üí database ‚Üí AI runtime), shared component library catalog, app deployment pipeline, database schema overview, automation/cron system, skills ecosystem, memory/context system, design system highlights, and scalability roadmap. Use a dark glass-morphism theme with amber/gold accents. Each slide should be concise with visual hierarchy ‚Äî headers, stat cards, two-column layouts, and tag clouds where appropriate.

title: Component Library Value Pitch
prompt: Write a concise pitch explaining the value of a shared web component library with 40+ components serving 44 apps. Cover: zero-duplication benefits, convention-over-configuration approach, how one script import gives every app navigation, auth, modals, toasts, animations, filters, and data display. Include specific examples like cc-app-nav for consistent navigation, cc-auth for password gating, cc-modal for dialogs, cc-empty-state for empty data views, and animation components (fade-in, stagger, reveal) for polished UX. Emphasize the 2-minute deploy time from conversation to live site.

title: System Metrics Dashboard Summary
prompt: Generate a comprehensive metrics summary for an AI-powered web platform with: 44 deployed web apps across 4 categories (CC modules, business tools, consumer/fun, developer tools), 40 shared web components, 36 automation skills, 17 persistent memory files, 1600-line design system, 11+ Supabase database tables, 12+ service integrations, and 16 scheduled cron jobs. Format as a structured report with sections for each subsystem, current counts, and growth trends. Include a health assessment for each area.

title: Skills Ecosystem Documentation
prompt: Document a skills ecosystem with 36 skills organized into 6 categories: App Building (create-app, landing-page, ads-page, docs-page, ideas-page, logs-page, prompts-page, list-view, database, nightly-review), Idea Pipeline (capture, discovery, generation, review, scoring), Research (company, lead, people-lookup, people, personality, travel-destination), Dev/Ops (build-orchestrator, code-review, seo-audit, productionize, workspace-info, kanban), Integrations (gamma, twilio, resend-email, zoom-intelligence, ga4-reporting), and Maintenance (memory-hygiene, backlog-meeting, alpha-wins, session-logs). For each skill, describe its trigger, inputs, outputs, and how it connects to other skills in the ecosystem.

title: Memory System Architecture Explainer
prompt: Explain the architecture of a dual-write AI memory system that uses 17 markdown files for fast local access and Supabase PostgreSQL for durable storage. Cover: identity files (core.md with 5x priority protection, preferences.md, decisions.md), work files (apps registry, components catalog, clients, people), operations files (open-items, integrations-log, project-history, code-review-learnings), and daily files (rolling 5-day brainstorm). Explain how core memories cannot be overwritten by AI, how the dual-write ensures both speed and durability, and how the memory system provides continuity across sessions.
